content.content:
`.orders`

Use the **orders** resource to create, read, update and delete sales orders in
a merchant's store, you can edit all order properties and also work with all
order subresources directly at this resource

meta.description: URL to checkout page, if necessary, use (`_id`) where order unique ID must appear at URL - Max length: **255** - Format: **uri**
Optional checkout URL specific to mobile devices - Max length: **255** - Format: **uri**
URL to order status page, if necessary, use (`_id`) where order unique ID must appear - Max length: **255** - Format: **uri**
Optional status URL specific to mobile devices - Max length: **255** - Format: **uri**
UTM campaign HTTP parameters
Parameter "`utm_source`", the referrer: (e.g. google, newsletter) - Max length: **100**
Parameter "`utm_medium`", the marketing medium: (e.g. cpc, banner, email) - Max length: **100**
Parameter "`utm_campaign`", the product, promo code, or slogan (e.g. `spring_sale`) - Max length: **200**
Parameter "`utm_term`", identifies the paid keywords - Max length: **100**
Parameter "`utm_content`", used to differentiate ads - Max length: **255**
The website that the customer clicked on to come to the shop - Max length: **255** - Format: **uri**
Code to identify the affiliate that referred the customer - Max length: **200**
Where the order originated - Max length: **30**
IP address of the browser used by the customer when placing the order - Max length: **30** - Format: **ipv4**
Channel unique identificator
Channel type or source
Store domain name (numbers and lowercase letters, eg.: www.myshop.sample) - Min length: **4** - Max length: **100** - RegEx pattern: **`^[0-9a-z-.]+$`**
Order number, if not specified will be filled auto incrementing
Order code used by seller and customer for identification, should be unique - Max length: **70**
Order main status
Date and time when order was opened, in ISO 8601 standard representation - Format: **date-time**
If the order is closed, specify the date and time it occurred - Format: **date-time**
If the order is cancelled, specify the date and time it occurred - Format: **date-time**
If the order is cancelled, specify the reason why it was cancelled
Order status created by seller - Max length: **50**
Financial status and date of change
Last status change, date and time in ISO 8601 standard representation - Format: **date-time**
Order financial status
Fulfillment status and date of change
Last status change, date and time in ISO 8601 standard representation - Format: **date-time**
Order fulfillment (shipping) status
Designator of currency according to ISO 4217 (3 uppercase letters) - RegEx pattern: **`^[A-Z]{3}$`**
Graphic symbol used as a shorthand for currency's name - Max length: **20**
Object with sums of values
Order total amount - Mininum: **0** - Maximum: **9999999999** - Max precision: **0.00001**
The sum of all items prices - Mininum: **0** - Maximum: **9999999999** - Max precision: **0.00001**
Order freight cost - Mininum: **0** - Maximum: **9999999999** - Max precision: **0.00001**
Applied discount value - Mininum: **0** - Maximum: **9999999999** - Max precision: **0.00001**
The sum of all the taxes applied to the order - Mininum: **0** - Maximum: **9999999999** - Max precision: **0.00001**
Sum of optional extra costs applied - Mininum: **0** - Maximum: **9999999999** - Max precision: **0.00001**
Name or summary of order payment method(s) - Max length: **100**
Name of order shipping method(s) - Max length: **100**
List of order customers - Max elements: **20**
Customer ID - RegEx pattern: **`^[a-f0-9]{24}$`**
Customer language two letter code, sometimes with region, eg.: `pt_br`, fr, `en_us` - RegEx pattern: **`^[a-z]{2}(_[a-z]{2})?$`**
Customer main email address - Max length: **200** - Format: **email**
List of customer email addresses - Max elements: **20**
The actual email address - Max length: **200** - Format: **email**
The type of email
States whether or not the email address has been verified
The name of this Customer, suitable for display - Max length: **50**
Customer name object
The family name of this user, or "last name" - Max length: **70**
The "first name" of this user - Max length: **70**
The middle name(s) of this user - Max length: **255**
Customer gender, female, male or third gender (X)
User profile pictures - Max elements: **20**
Image URL
List of customer phone numbers - Max elements: **20**
Country calling code (without `+`), defined by standards E.123 and E.164
The actual phone number, digits only - Max length: **19** - RegEx pattern: **`^[0-9]+$`**
The type of phone
Physical or juridical (company) person
Country of document origin, an ISO 3166-2 code - Min length: **2** - Max length: **2** - RegEx pattern: **`^[A-Z]+$`**
Responsible person or organization document number (only numbers) - Max length: **19** - RegEx pattern: **`^[0-9]+$`**
Municipal or state registration if exists
Municipal or state registration number (with characters) if exists - Max length: **50**
Registered company name or responsible fullname - Max length: **255**
If order is originated from a gifts list, specify customers who will receive the gift - Max elements: **20**
Customer ID - RegEx pattern: **`^[a-f0-9]{24}$`**

content.content:
*/orders.json?limit&offset&sort&fields\&[field]* > Authentication
_GET_: **required** Use [default URL parameters](#introduction/overview/url-params) (metadata) for pagination and ordering, you can use any other parameter to query by particular object properties

meta.description: Max number of objects to return
meta.title: number

meta.description: First entry to return
meta.title: number

meta.description: Rules to order resultant objects
meta.title: string

meta.description: Object properties to return
meta.title: string

meta.description: Object property to query
meta.title: string

content.content:
*/orders.json* > Authentication
_POST_: **required** Request body must obey the specifications of [this model](#reference/orders/order-object)

*/orders/[_id].json* > Authentication
_GET_: **optional**
_PATCH_, _PUT_, _DELETE_: **required** In read requests, response body will follow [this model](#reference/orders/order-object), requests without authentication will receive order data without `browser_ip`, `buyer`, `gift_to`, `shipping_lines`, `transactions`, `payments_history`, `fulfillments`, `hidden_metafields`, `private_metafields` and `staff_notes` properties For overwriting and editing, request body must obey the same specifications, but especially for edit requests there are no required fields

meta.description: The order ID
meta.title: string
